page.title: 11TENDRINGS FARM (SITE)
page.content: The site has always been farmland and originally belonged to{Lord {Strathcona.}In 1950 the estate was split up and sold. Now{Tendrings House stands in 4 acres and the wood around it protects it from the elements as it is very exposed. The wood mainly cosists of hazel,blue spruce,silver birch,oak and yew trees. The gardens are extensive and contain many shrubs and a vegetable plot. There is still evidence of the old farm buildings including a{cow {shed}with the{original oak beams.}This particular building is now used to house cars. The original{granary}still remains. This is a small wooden building raised by bricks to deter rats. This building is still totally water-proof with the roof supported by oak beams.
